data.name: Traditional Dry
data.description: Our Traditional Dry cider is made in the style of English draft ciders. This cider is bittersweet and slightly spicy with a bright apple aroma. It is a leaner cider with a dry finish and without any juice added to impart extra sweetness.

breweries.name: Mad Moon Craft Cidery
breweries.description: We began our hard cider production in a modest warehouse in 2014. We aspire for an artful production of fresh-pressed, hard apple cider. Crafted from locally grown apples; brewed in small unfiltered batches. Our goal is to produce amazing, creative flavors drawing inspiration from the craft beer revolution. We strive to support the local market by using Ohio apples and other local products.

data.name: Trocken
data.description: One of our staples, Trokken is German for “dry”.  This is the epitome of a a traditional German cider.  Light and crisp, this cider is easy to drink: the perfect beverage for sharing with a pal.

data.name: Troy MMXIII (2013)
data.description: The latest Troy Hard Cider, produced primarily from apples harvested in and around Sebastapol, California in 2013, starts the show with a rich, straw-hued hazy coloring that suggests no filtration and likely no fining. The aroma sports a sweetly sour note that serves as a strong layering over the peach and apple notes that linger below. There is a definite Asturian character to this cider that is made with Apples, pears and a little quince. It’s a light bodied sip that possesses a good balanced of moderate tannin and acid., but delivers a very smooth caress across the palate. The carbonation here is extraordinarily slight. The flavors follow the nose. A sour, acetic character that will remind most of fresh, light vinegar is first and foremost onto the palate. And there is a certain fresh intensity to this flavor. Past this, you get to notes of dry hay, herbs, and sour apple. The cider finishes with a slight bitter note derived from lingering tannins. This is a very unique American cider insofar as the aroma and flavor profile is unlike most produced in this country, though it will be very familiar to those who drink the Asturian ciders from Spain. It’s very good, very refreshing, unique and made with care and determination. Seek it out. - See more at: http://ciderjournal.com/review/troy-2013-wild-fermentation-hard-cider/#sthash.aBEczEwY.dpuf

breweries.name: Motorcycle Wineries
breweries.description:
Motorcycle Wineries distributes local wine and cider in the SF Bay Area. I ride around the globe, searching for unique wines and goodies, and host exclusive events for Bay Area residents. We work with independent restaurants and stores who share our focus on authentic human connection, laughter, and adventure. Send us a note to see our current inventory and set up a tasting.  Sign up for our mailing list if you would like to hear about our underground dinners, gallery openings and music events, new wines, or simply to follow the adventure.
Philosophy

The integrity of the Motorcycle Wineries is my own integrity. There is not much that you need for a life that is a complete joy to lead. Love, freedom, beauty. And yet there are some physical things that can create magic. A bottle of wine with the one you love, a picnic in the rose garden with a baguette and olive oil, a sparklingly joyous cider to make a memorable night with friends unforgettable. Luxury is not born from spending a lot of money on stuff society expects you to buy. It is not comfort. It is not status. It is the scene of Meryl Streep getting her hair washed in the middle of the African savannah. That magic is the purpose. Everything that I offer has given me a glimpse into the incredible beauty and complexity of our world. That is what I hope to share with you.

Thank you for being a part of the Motorcycle Wineries.

breweries.name: Mountain Goat
breweries.description:
Dave and Cam learned to be persistent. Really persistent. They finally secured the required funds from friends, family and a business banker who wanted them out of his face.

Today the boys operate their very own microbrewery in Richmond (inner Melbourne). They craft the Hightail Ale, Organic Steam Ale plus seasonal beers in longnecks like the Surefoot Stout , IPA and Double Hightail.

“The plant is very labor intensive, but we can squeeze great beer out of it” says Dave. “And after hand filling, capping and labelling just on 2 million bottles you can well imagine we’re pretty happy about putting in a small, automated bottling line.”

Mountain Goat has collected a swag of awards over the years for their traditional, all natural ales and now has about 80 bars in Melbourne pouring their beers on tap plus bottled beer distributed nationally.

So why Mountain Goat? Well, a mountain goat’s a big hairy animal that’s never gonna fall over.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
We open the brewery to public every Friday evening from 5pm. 
We’re also open Wednesday nights from 5 and hold free brewery tours at 6.30 (no need to book for groups under 4). We’re usually in here brewing Wed nights so it’s a great opportunity to see the process happening and earbash a brewer.

data.name: UVANA
data.description:
Made with a 50/50 blend of Colorado wine grapes 
 and apples. In Spanish Uva = grape, Manzana = apple,
 we combined them for UVANA.  Delicate fruit flavors,
 a snappy middle and a dry finish with very few bubbles.

Gluten Free - 6.9% ABV -  in 500ml bottles

breweries.name: Colorado Cider Company
breweries.description: The Colorado Cider Company was founded to produce a fresh hard cider for the discerning Colorado drinker. With a well-developed craft beer market and an educated populace Hard Cider has been a missing choice in the cacophony of craft drinks in local pubs and liquor stores. We hope to remedy that. We're getting out in the market, check out our "Find us" page!

data.name: Village Tart
data.description:
Cherry. Crisp. Tart.
She’s everything you’d expect. Sweet like a cherry and sharp as a tack, she puts a luster on the dullest mood. Tart montmorency cherries meld with tart apples for a delightful addition to any occasion. Just sweet enough.

breweries.name: Pollyanna Brewing Company
breweries.description:
"Pollyanna" is defined as irrepressibly optimistic. It reflects the idea of finding something to be glad about in every situation.

Opening a production brewery and taproom is a time consuming and calculated process that certainly requires plenty of optimism. We want to share with you our beer, our passion, and the optimistic approach that has led us to this point.

We're excited to build new memories and experiences as well as enrich our local community by always keeping the glass half-full. We're opening soon, so hang tight!

breweries.name: Northville Winery & Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Our year round tasting room opened in June 2012. We have wine, hard cider and beer tasting, wine, hard cider and beer by the glass, outdoor seating and live acoustic music. The Northville Winery originated across the parking lot in Parmenters Northville Cider Mill in 1982. Rob and Carina Nelson started making their own wine over 5 years ago and they have been expanding ever since, including adding a microbrewery this year. All of our grapes and apples are brought in from the West side of Michigan. We then do all the pressing in the cider mill and fermenting and bottling in the winery building. Every bottle is filled and labeled by hand. The winery produces several alcoholic wines, hard cider flavors and most recently BEER! We are also adding a small distillery soon!

breweries.name: Cider Brothers
breweries.description:
From early morning through late afternoon, we bring a winemaker’s approach to producing small batches of handcrafted hard apple ciders. It starts with cold fermenting small lots of fresh apple juice to capture the delicate flavors and complex balance that makes this Mother Nature’s most refreshing adult beverage. The result is our refreshing, lightly carbonated artisan cider, produced at our Lodi winery.

Starting around sunset, we bring a cider lover’s approach, along with a bottle opener and a couple of chilled glasses, and enjoy the fruits of our daytime jobs. Join us tonight on our journey to great taste and enjoy America’s first adult beverage.

breweries.name: Vermont Hard Cider Company
breweries.description:
At Woodchuck®, we do things our own way. We start with the finest ingredients crafted at our local cidery here in Middlebury, Vermont. Then our cider-master meticulously oversees the details of every small batch before any bottle or keg leaves our back door. It’s this special attention and love for our product that ensures we always deliver a smooth unique hard cider that is true to our roots. 
Independent to the core®.

data.name: Yakima Valley Dry Hopped Cider
data.description: The Yakima Valley is known worldwide as a premier apple growing region and a prominent source of hops.  We have chosen a select blend of traditional and exotic hops to marry with our cider. This blend of hops produces an aroma of fruit-forward nuttiness followed by a citrusy palate.

style.name: Fruit Cider

breweries.name: Tieton Cider Works
breweries.description:
The fruit that is used in Tieton Cider Works cider comes from Craig and Sharon Campbell’s Harmony Orchards. This land has been in our family since the 1920’s when our grandfather planted his first trees in Tieton, Washington. We take our stewardship of the land seriously and have been farming organically for the last 25 years.

As a third generation Yakima Valley farmer with a degree in horticulture from Washington State University and over thirty five years’ experience in marketing produce, Craig has always been curious about the back-story: the history, production, science, and industry of food. Growing different varieties of trees is truly what makes Craig happy and he is always looking for new varieties to plant and nurture.  In 2008 he was introduced to cider apple varieties, those gnarly, inedible wild apple varieties needed to make great cider.  He planted twenty five varieties in a test block of two acres to study the growing patterns: did each fit into the existing bloom and harvest schedule of the farm, what were the flavor profiles of the fruit and how did that variety add to the cider that we wanted to make.

From that original twenty five, Craig has narrowed it down to the eight most suitable for commercial production, never closing the door on annual experimentation when he learns of a new variety. We now have the largest acreage of cider apples and Perry pears in the state of Washington with 55 acres.

The Yakima Valley is the largest apple producing region in Washington and there is an infrastructure existing in our valley that provides many advantages when you are making cider.  Whether we are storing our apples in controlled atmosphere, sending our apricots and cherries to be processed, or selecting the complementary hops and pumpkin for our seasonal ciders – it all exists in the valley we call home.

A love of land, food and drink has inspired us to make cider with the fruit we are growing at our ranch, Harmony Orchards.  We know the ciders we make are an expression of the harvest and reflective of the fruit and the place that it is grown.

data.name: Zesty Blood Orange

breweries.name: Bulmers Cider
breweries.description: H.P. Bulmer, otherwise known as Bulmers Cider, was founded in 1887 in Hereford, England by Percy Bulmer, the 20 year old son of the local rector at Credenhill, taking his mother's advice to make a career in food or drink, "because neither ever go out of fashion". Bulmers cider can be found worldwide and Strongbow is sold across Europe, Scandinavia, USA, Australasia and the Far East. The company is owned by Heineken.
